greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the reverse concatenation of divisors of n.
comment: Union of A089374(n) for n >= 1 and A175354(n) for n >= 2. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Apr 17 2011
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..50000
example: For n=12; divisors of 12: 1,2,3,4,6,12; a(12)=1264321 (reverse concatenation).
mathematica: Table[FromDigits@ Flatten@ Map[IntegerDigits, Reverse@ Divisors@ n], {n, 34}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 23 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {s = ""; fordiv(n, d, s = concat(Str(d), s)); eval(s);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 16 2015
def a(n): return int("".join(str(d) for d in divisors(n)[::-1]))
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 35)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Dec 31 2020
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Apr 20 2010
